edu.gatech.mbse.transformations.sysml2milp

Class SysML2MILPMappingsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.mbse.transformations.sysml2milp.SysML2MILPMappingsHelper

  • public class SysML2MILPMappingsHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a number of helper functions meant to outlie some complex traversal algorithms and keep them separate from the actual mappings performed. These functions include functions that compute and generate certain constraints (e.g., related to the semantics of shared and composite aggregation).
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Sebastian

    • Method Detail

      • declareStandardVariables

        public static java.lang.String declareStandardVariables(MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Declare standard variables used throughout the MILP formulation.

        Note that a precondition for this function is that the internal correspondences and transformation cache should already be built up - otherwise this will result in matrices of size 0.

        Parameters:
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP code declaring and / or defining standard variables. These are defined / declared at the very beginning of a target MILP script since they are referenced throughout.

      • getNumInstancesForResource

        public static int getNumInstancesForResource(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element e)
        Returns the number of instances that are created for a particular resource type.

        Note that this function simply accesses one of the maps created when performing pre-computations in InternalCorrespondences. Therefore, the computation of these internal correspondences should be a pre-condition to calling this method.

        Parameters:
        e - The resource type.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of instances that can be created given the functional specification being considered.

      • getTotalNumberOfResourceInstances

        public static int getTotalNumberOfResourceInstances()
        Returns the total number of resource instances created.
        Returns:
        The total number of instances for all resource types.

      • getTotalNumberOfCompositeResourceInstances

        public static int getTotalNumberOfCompositeResourceInstances()
        Returns the total number of composite resource instances created.
        Returns:
        The total number of instances for all aggregate resource types.

      • addCompositeResourceIntegrityConstraints

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> addCompositeResourceIntegrityConstraints(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier resource)
        Compute constraints related to ensuring that a sufficient number of instances of types of resources that are defined to be parts of aggregate / composite resource instances are part of the solution.

        The generated constraints take the form of sum(Part1Instances) + sum(Part2Instances) + ... >= sum(AggregateInstances). Note that this assumes a multiplicity of 1 for all parts (current limitation). ">=" is used for relaxation and more efficient computation by the solver. Note that this relaxation may lead to non-sensical results when multiple solutions are created.

        Parameters:
        resource - The resource type to create the appropriate constraints for.
        Returns:
        An ordered list of constraints (as String objects).

      • addCompositeResourceAllocationConstraints

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> addCompositeResourceAllocationConstraints(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier resource,
                                                                              int instance)
        Compute a set of constraints that ensure that the correct resource instances are allocated to the correct aggregate resources.

        This method computes three types of constraints:
        1) If any 1s appear in a row in matrix A (i.e., the particular resource instance is allocated to some function), then a 1 must appear in the cell defined by the row and column of the particular aggregate resource (i.e., the instance is allocated to itself in matrix C).
        2) If a resource instance is allocated to itself in C (i.e., constraint 1) holds then "compatible" parts allocated in A must also be allocated in C.
        3) The difference between the values in each column in A for the column of the aggregate resource instance must be greater than 0 (otherwise a resource instance is allocated in C that is not allocated in A)

        Parameters:
        resource - The composite / aggregate resource to generate the constraints for.
        instance - The instance number of the aggregate resource.
        Returns:
        An ordered list of constraints (as Strings).

      • addCompositeResourceAllocationConstraintsIgnoreNonCompositeParts

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> addCompositeResourceAllocationConstraintsIgnoreNonCompositeParts(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier resource)
        Adds constraints related to the composite allocation matrix to quickly identify regions that are always 0.

        Note that this function adds a constraint for instances of a specified resource that are not part of any considered composite resource.

        Parameters:
        resource - The resource type that is not a composite / aggregate resource or a part of any aggregate resource.
        instance - The instance being transformed.
        Returns:
        Returns an ordered list of the relevant constraints (in String form).

      • addResourceShareabilityConstraints

        public static java.lang.String addResourceShareabilityConstraints(MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Adds constraints related to the shareability of resources for all types of resources and their respective instances relevant to the particular design problem.
        Parameters:
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        MILP code containing constraint definitions.

      • addNonShareabilityConstraints

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> addNonShareabilityConstraints(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element r,
                                                                  java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> shareableResources,
                                                                  java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> nonShareableResources,
                                                                  java.util.HashMap<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> resourceActivityIDsMapping,
                                                                  MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Adds non-shareability constraints for a particular resource.
        Parameters:
        r - The resource type being considered.
        shareableResources - A list of shareable resources.
        nonShareableResources - A list of non-shareable resources.
        resourceActivityIDsMapping - A mapping from function definitions (activities) to a list of internal identifiers representing working principle / function instances.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.
        Returns:
        An ordere list of constraints (as string objects).

      • generateNonShareabilityActWPCondition

        public static java.lang.String generateNonShareabilityActWPCondition(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element r,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> shareableResources,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> nonShareableResources,
                                                     java.util.HashMap<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> resourceActivityIDsMapping)
        Creates the left hand side of the non-shareability constraint.

        The left-hand side determines the minimal number of required resource instances to fulfill the shareability constraints imposed by shared and composite aggregations. It is computed through binary logic and arithmetic, ORing (with "|") those instances where resources can be shared (create 1 instance at least if any of the binary variables are true) and adding where compositions are used (need at least n additional ones). Also see developer documentation.

        Parameters:
        r - The element to create the left-hand side of the constraint for.
        shareableResources - A list of shareable resources.
        nonShareableResources - A list of non-shareable resources.
        resourceActivityIDsMapping - A mapping from function definitions (activities) to a list of internal identifiers representing working principle / function instances.
        Returns:
        The left hand-side of the relevant constraint.

      • getNonShareableSubResources

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> getNonShareableSubResources(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element r,
                                                                            java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> nonShareableResources)
        Finds the non-shareable resources in the inheritance tree below the specified element r (below in terms of inheritance).
        Parameters:
        r - The element to start from.
        nonShareableResources - A list of non-shareable resources.
        Returns:
        A list of elements from nonShareableResources that are specializations of the given resource or the resource itself.

      • findTopMostShareable

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier findTopMostShareable(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier r,
                                                   java.util.ArrayList<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element> shareableResources)
        Finds "top most" shareable resource in inheritance hierarchy using a simple breadth first search.

        The inheritance tree is searched breadth first (from specific to general) to find the deepest nested shareable resource (i.e., most general classifier that is in a shared aggregation somewhere).

        Parameters:
        r - The resource to perform the search for.
        shareableResources - A list of shareable resources.
        Returns:
        The top-most shareable resource.

      • isNonShareableWithinContext

        public static boolean isNonShareableWithinContext(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element resource,
                                  java.lang.String actWPInstanceID)
        Check whether a particular resource is shareable within a certain context.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource type.
        actWPInstanceID - The particular function / working principle internal ID.
        Returns:
        true if the given resource is non-shareable within the context of the specified function / working principle combination and false otherwise.

      • displayPropertiesOfUMLClass

        public static void displayPropertiesOfUMLClass(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier classifier,
                               MILPModel2TextUtils milpGen)
        Produce some visual output of a UML classifier by adding it to the visualization buffer.

        This method will simply go through the list of owned and inherited attributes, check whether a given property has a numeric value and, if it does, create code for the target MILP environment that will display the property name and the associated value. Note: this is currently somewhat MATLAB specific syntax.

        Parameters:
        classifier - The classifier to produce the output for.
        milpGen - The MILP code generation object.

      • storeCorrespondences

        public static void storeCorrespondences(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier classifier,
                        java.lang.String identifier)
        Stores internal correspondences for a classifier. Works for resource instances, system under design and working principles.

        Note that the code being generated for the correspondences is MATLAB specific. In future, this should be replaced by the creation of a separate correspondence model. Here, we "abuse" the visualization buffer for this purpose.

        General syntax of the output is: IF a particular possible instance is part of the solution, write sufficient information for the back transformation into the file postfixed with _instanceData.

        Parameters:
        classifier - The classifier to store an internal correspondence for.
        internalIdentifier - The internal identifier of the classifier.

      • generateInstanceDataOutputFilePreamble

        public static java.lang.String generateInstanceDataOutputFilePreamble()
        Generate Matlab code that deletes an old file and opens a fresh writeable copy of a file used in storing the instance data.
        Returns:
        A string containing MATLAB specific code to delete any existing instance data output file and then open a new copy.

      • generateInstanceDataOutputFilePostamble

        public static java.lang.String generateInstanceDataOutputFilePostamble()
        Postamble for correspondence data.
        Returns:
        MATLAB specific code that closes the instanceData file.
